faq.question: How do I earn the most points?
faq.answer: Check in at Maker venues for double points, and always submit a Vibe Report with a photo and marketing consent to maximize your haul. Updating game statuses like Pool or Darts also adds a nice bonus!

faq.question: What can I do with my League points?
faq.answer: Points determine your standing in the season leaderboard. Top players get invited to exclusive Artesian parties and get first dibs on limited-edition OlyBars merch.

faq.question: How do I join the League?
faq.answer: Head to the LEAGUE HQ tab and look for the 'Join the League' CTA. You'll need to create a Handle and set your game preferences (replacing the old 'League Preferences') to start earning points for glory and digital trophies (Badges).

faq.question: Why can't I check in?
faq.answer: Check-ins are limited to 2 per 12-hour window per WA State LCB alignment. Check-ins also require you to be within 100 meters of the Anchor Venue (measured via GPS).

faq.question: What do the Vibes mean?
faq.answer: We use a 4-tier scale: Dead (Quiet, <20% cap), Chill (Easy conversation), Buzzing (High energy, table full), and Packed (Standing room only, party peaking!).

faq.question: How do Pulse Alerts work?
faq.answer: Pulse Alerts keep you in the loop without the spam. Star a venue to 'Subscribe'. We'll text you specifically when that spot hits 'Packed' status so you don't miss the peak!

faq.question: How do I change my Handle?
faq.answer: You can update your Handle once every 30 days in your Profile settings. This ensures League integrity and leaderboard consistency.

faq.question: Is my data secure?
faq.answer: OlyBars uses Firebase Auth and Firestore for secure identity management. We only log actions required for points calculation and league standings.

faq.question: Where do I find Live Music?
faq.answer: Check the LIVE tab (Navigation Bar) for a dedicated gig guide and submission portal for local bands.

faq.question: What is Artie?
faq.answer: Artie is OlyBars' official AI concierge, powered by Well 80. He helps players find the right vibe and helps venue owners manage their presence.

faq.question: What is The Weekly Buzz?
faq.answer: The Weekly Buzz is our community email that drops every week. It features bartender spotlights, deep dives into local bar history, and curated 'Trivia Cheat Codes' for savvy league players.

faq.question: What is 'The Brew House'?
faq.answer: The Brew House is the official name for the OlyBars Owner Dashboard. It's where partners manage their listings, Flash Bounties, and menu items. Think of it as your venue's mission control.

faq.question: How does Artie help with marketing?
faq.answer: Artie is now a Multimodal Marketing Co-Pilot. Through 'The Brew House', venue owners can use Artie to generate marketing images, draft emails, update their websites, and sync events to social media automatically.

faq.question: What is 'The Manual'?
faq.answer: The Manual is the definitive guide for both players and partners. For players, it's the FAQ/Wiki. For partners, it's the 'Partner Manual' found in The Brew House, detailing how to use Artie and the Marketing Suite effectively.

history_timeline.1895_epiphany: Leopold Schmidt, a Montana brewer, visited Tumwater and tested the artesian water. It matched the water of Pilsen, Bohemia (birthplace of lager). He declared: 'With this water, I believe I can brew better beer than ever.'
history_timeline.1896_founding: The Capital Brewing Company (later Olympia Brewing) was founded. First batch released Oct 1, 1896.
history_timeline.1902_the_slogan: Frank Kenney proposed 'It's the Water'. Schmidt initially wanted 'The Water Makes It', but Kenney won. It became a legendary tagline linking the beer to the geology.
history_timeline.1916_prohibition: WA State went dry 4 years before the nation. The brewery pivoted to fruit jams and juices to keep workers employed.
history_timeline.1933_repeal_phoenix: Prohibition ended. The 'Old Brewhouse' (brick) was abandoned for the modern 'Knoll' facility upstream.
history_timeline.1935_stubby: Olympia introduced the 'Stubby' bottleâ€”no deposit, easier to ship, became an icon.
history_timeline.1970s_pop_culture: Olympia Beer appeared in Clint Eastwood movies (Magnum Force, etc.) as a symbol of the authentic West. The 'Artesians' ad campaign launched.
history_timeline.1983_consolidation: Schmidt family sold to Heileman. Beginning of the 'Corporate Carousel' (Stroh, Pabst, Miller).
history_timeline.2003_the_silence: SABMiller closed the Tumwater brewery on June 27, 2003. 400 jobs lost. A psychic wound for the city.
history_timeline.2025_the_revival: Olympia Beer returns via Great Western Brewing (Canada) and a 'Revival' recipe in Texas. Olympia Distilling Co. continues the legacy with vodka made from the artesian water.

market_context.closed_system: We only allow bars in Olympia in our database/directory/site/app. Artie is the concierge for this specific ecosystem.
market_context.data_provenance: Primary data comes from our internal OlyBars directory. Secondary observations come from monitoring social media and local event listings to capture the 'Artesian Buzz'.
market_context.the_phoenix_effect: Corporate-lite models are failing; scrappy, personality-driven venues are rising. example: Ilk Lodge rising from the ashes of Fish Tale Brewpub.
market_context.origin_value: In a saturated market, 'Story' is the only differentiator. Why drive past 3 bars? Because of the origin story.
market_context.micro_reality_check: Every venue is vetted by 4 personas: Pit (Soul/Dive), Todd (Ops/Food), Chris (Data/Stability), Stephanie (Atmosphere/Safety).
market_context.ghost_list: Venues that failed the reality check or closed: Locust Cider (Closed), Finnriver Tumwater (Closed). We do NOT send users there.

history_revenue_loop.core_concept: Solving the 'Utility Gap' by using history as a hook to drive revenue. We do not publish history for history's sake.
history_revenue_loop.the_loop: 1. Hook (Blog/SEO) -> 2. Nudge (Trivia Cheat Code) -> 3. Visit (Venue Revenue) -> 4. Reward (Badge).
compliance_rules: No 'Pabst' Branding: Tell the story of the city, not the corporate trademark. Use 'The original 1896 brew'.
Link to Revenue: Every history nugget must link to a venue action (e.g., 'Sit in the original booths at The Spar').
history_revenue_loop.trivia_integration: We drive traffic to trivia nights by giving members answers in advance via our content.

flash_bounty.name: Flash Bounties - THE HARD RULES
rules: 180-MINUTE RULE: All deals MUST be scheduled at least 180 minutes (3 hours) in advance. No exceptions.
If a user tries to schedule a deal for sooner than 3 hours from now, YOU MUST REFUSE and coach them.
TOKEN ECONOMY: Monthly limits apply based on Tier: FREE (1), DIY (2), PRO (4), AGENCY (8).
ROTATION: Max 3 concurrent deals city-wide. If a slot has other deals, warn the user about 'BUSY' rotation.
PIT RULE: You MUST ask: 'Have you told your staff/bartender about this deal?' before confirming.

sequence: [RATIONALE]: A private note on why you are saying this.

technical_directives: VENUE SEARCH: If user mentions a venue or asks for bars/happy hours, YOU MUST CALL venueSearch. Do NOT ask for city/state.
MAKER SPOTLIGHT: If user asks about 'Local Makers', breweries, wineries, cideries, distilleries, CALL makerSpotlight.
LEAGUE: If user asks about points, leaderboard, or rules, CALL leagueLeaderboard or knowledgeSearch.
EVENTS: If user asks about what's happening, CALL eventDiscovery.
VENUE OPS (Owner/Manager ONLY): If user wants to update their venue (hours, deals, posts), AND has role 'owner'/'manager', use operatorAction. If not authorized, politely refuse.

LCB COMPLIANCE: Refuse 'Bottomless', 'All you can drink', 'Free shots'. Suggest 'Tasting Flight' or 'Toast' instead.
